data.description: Job Posting Title:WDW Analytical & Strategic Planning Intern, Fall 2026Req ID:10139790Job Description:About the Role & Program"We create happiness." That's our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you'll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!The approximate dates of this internship are June - December 2026.What You Will DoAs a member a Engineering team, you will help to engineer the magic. You will join a team that works every single day to craft, build, service and maintain a level of service that exceeds our client and guest expectations! Your team's responsibilities may include:Work Measurement - perform time and motion studies in Textiles operation to develop labor standards for accurate evaluation of labor performance.Insights - analyze data looking for trends, commonalities and other statistical characteristics to identify improvement opportunities to increase efficiency and reduce cost.Execution – turn ideas into solutions by collaborating with different contributors to acquire consensus prior to implementation.Analytics – become guide in Textiles data collecting, analysis and visualization, with the ability to present results to different audiences for clear and concise messaging.Quality - support Quality related efforts by setting up data collection studies including sample sizes, data collection forms and reporting.Required Qualifications & SkillsExperience in Excel, Access and PowerPoint (required)Experience with data visualization software (Tableau or Grafana)Experience with statistical analysis through SQLKnowledge of work measurement techniques and methodKnowledge of Quality analysis methods like Fishbone diagrams, RCCA, 5Why’sPreferred QualificationsSuccessful completion of the Disney College Program or Disney Professional InternshipEducationCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree or Post Graduate degree at an accredited 4-year college or university majoring in an Engineering related major including: Industrial, Manufacturing, Quality, Systems or related majorJunior, Senior or Graduate student status by arrival datePreferred EducationCumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher (Note: Please, no rounding) as shown on a transcript.Eligibility Requirements & Program InformationBe enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.  Be at least 18 years of agePossess unrestricted work authorizationCurrent Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants:  You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.   Additional InformationBe compliant with The Disney Look appearance guidelinesFully available from Monday through Friday with occasional weekends or holidays pending project need, up to 40 hours each week, early mornings or late nights are a possibility, bulk of work time will be during traditional 8am-5pmAble to provide/have reliable transportation to/from workWe provide limited housing opportunities for Florida Based Professional Interns through American Campus Communities, for more information click here The pay rate for this role in Orlando FL is $31 for undergraduate student per hour and $36 for graduate student per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.Job Posting Segment:Worldwide Safety, Health, Engineer & SourcingJob Posting Primary Business:Safety Assurance (WSHES)Primary Job Posting Category:Engineering Intern, OtherEmployment Type:Full timePrimary City, State, Region, Postal Code:Lake Buena Vista, FL, USAAlternate City, State, Region, Postal Code:Date Posted:2026-01-26
requirements: Experience in Excel, Access and PowerPoint (required)

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree or Post Graduate degree at an accredited 4-year college or university majoring in an Engineering related major including: Industrial, Manufacturing, Quality, Systems or related major
Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.
Be at least 18 years of age
Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants:  You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.
responsibilities: Work Measurement - perform time and motion studies in Textiles operation to develop labor standards for accurate evaluation of labor performance.

Fully available from Monday through Friday with occasional weekends or holidays pending project need, up to 40 hours each week, early mornings or late nights are a possibility, bulk of work time will be during traditional 8am-5pm
